Discord Rich Presence (<10.14)¶

This article is applicable to the following wrappers:
• slc’s Wineskin for macOS 10.14 Mojave and earlier
• Technocoder’s unofficial Wineskin for macOS 10.14 Mojave and earlier

Note

This section is for users on macOS 10.14 and earlier. If you use macOS 10.15 and later, then the process behind Discord Rich Presence is slightly different - you actually can enable Discord Rich Presence with relative ease.

Behaviour¶

osu! is not detected by Discord in the Game Activity menu, nor is it displayed on your profile.

Cause¶

It’s complicated.

And other people had a few issues too.

Tl;dr: noone has made a successful Discord Rich Presence solution running under macOS 32-bit Wineskins.

Resolution¶

If you read my Discord Rich Presence discussion article you’ll know why I had some trouble with getting Rich Presence to work on my Wineskin. I don’t really have time to look into this further, but you can try these instructions and see if they work for you:

Warning

These instructions are for macOS 10.14 and earlier. If you are using macOS 10.15 or later, these instructions will not work and you need to use this one instead.

  1. Download 0e4ef622’s Wine Discord IPC Bridge.

Download (GitHub mirror): https://github.com/0e4ef622/wine-discord-ipc-bridge/raw/master/winediscordipcbridge.exe

  1. Drag and drop the bridge into the same directory as osu!.exe

    • Locate where osu!.app (your Wineskin) is installed

    • Right click on it and select Show Package Contents

    • You should now see three files/folders: Contents, drive_c and Wineskin. Click drive_c.

    • From here, click osu!.

  2. Rename it bridge.exe (just to keep things simple)

  3. Open TextEdit (it should be in your Applications folder)

  4. Create a new text file. Inside it, copy and paste the following:

start C:\osu!\osu!.exe
start C:\osu!\bridge.exe

  1. Save it as execute.bat and place it inside of the osu! folder that we mentioned above. It should be stored in the same directory as osu!.exe and bridge.exe.

  2. Open your Wineskin options

    • Locate where osu!.app (your Wineskin) is installed

    • Right click on it and select Show Package Contents

    • You should now see three files/folders: Contents, drive_c and Wineskin. Click Wineskin.

  3. A window like the one below should pop up. Click Advanced

  1. A window like the one below should pop up.

In the Windows EXE text box, copy and paste the following:

C:\osu!\execute.bat

Tip

Alternatively, you could just click the Browse.. button and navigate to where you saved your execute.bat file.

If that didn’t work¶

In theory, this should enable you to connect osu! under Wine, to the Discord client on your Mac, but as previously mentioned, I wasn’t able to get it to work.

You can read more about this program on it’s GitHub page which contains information on how the bridge works and how to use it.

Note

Do you have anything to add? See our Contributing to see how you can contribute to these docs.
